attributes.action: Make Motorhomes that are based on commercial vehicles, exempt from ULEZ charges
attributes.additional_details:
Motorhome owners are being penalised against.  We have to drive through these area to get home.  Are we expected to pay a charge to park at our own property?  
Many campsites are close to cities and towns and would require us to drive through a ULEZ controlled area to get to a site that we have to pay to stay at.  This is going to increase the price of motorhoming and make it probably become a thing of the past.
attributes.background:
Motorhomes are generally based on commercial vehicles and because of this have been grouped into the commercial vehicle LEZ/ULEZ charges
- Motorhomes are generally privately owned, do relatively few miles each year, are looked after by their owners and therefore tend to last many years

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about about what classes of vehicle low emission schemes apply to is a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
